question.body: What problem(s) is/are associated with calcium homeostasis dysfunction?

response.feedback: Not quite. Calcium homeostasis dysfunction can cause heart disease, but it can cause bone disease as well.
Not quite. Calcium homeostasis dysfunction can cause bone disease, but it can cause heart disease as well.

Correct. The heart is often affected by large short-term calcium changes, and bones are often affected by small long-term calcium changes. Calcium homeostasis dysfunction can also affect muscle function and can result in the formation of kidney stones.
Incorrect. Calcium affects many organ systems.
